rev.comment: removed cubuntu, does not seem to be an official distribution

* [[Ubuntu JeOS]] (pronounced as "juice"), is described as "an efficient variant [...] configured specifically for [[virtual appliance]]s".<ref>{{ cite web | title = Ubuntu JeOS 7.10 released | url = https://lists.ubuntu.com/archives/ubuntu-announce/2007-November/000106.html }}</ref>
* [[Ubuntu JeOS]] (pronounced as "juice"), is described as "an efficient variant [...] configured specifically for [[virtual appliance]]s".<ref>{{ cite web | title = Ubuntu JeOS 7.10 released | url = https://lists.ubuntu.com/archives/ubuntu-announce/2007-November/000106.html }}</ref>
* [[Ubuntu Mobile and Embedded Edition|Ubuntu Mobile]], an Ubuntu edition that targets mobile Internet devices.<ref>[http://www.ubuntu.com/products/mobile Ubuntu Mobile]</ref>
* [[Ubuntu Mobile and Embedded Edition|Ubuntu Mobile]], an Ubuntu edition that targets mobile Internet devices.<ref>[http://www.ubuntu.com/products/mobile Ubuntu Mobile]</ref>

* [[Cubuntu]], described as "a fully featured (or as fully featured as you can get without a desktop environment) command line based Ubuntu derivative." (this is a temporary name as the developers are searching for a new one) [https://wiki.ubuntu.com/Cubuntu]
 
Unofficial variants and derivatives are not controlled or guided by [[Canonical Ltd.|Canonical]] and are generally [[Fork (software development)|forks]] with different goals in mind.
